text: Arthur Edmon Brown Jr. (born November 21, 1929) is an American military personnel. He was a United States Army four-star general who was Vice Chief of Staff of the United States Army (VCSA) from 1987 to 1989. ==Awards== Defense Distinguished Service Medal Army Distinguished Service Medal with one bronze oak leaf cluster Silver Star Legion of Merit with three oak leaf clusters Distinguished Flying Cross Bronze Star with "V" Device and two Oak Leaf Clusters Meritorious Service Medal Air Medal (9 awards) Joint Service Commendation Medal Army Commendation Medal with "V" device Army of Occupation Medal National Defense Service Medal with one Service star Vietnam Service Medal with five Service stars Army Service Ribbon Army Overseas Service Ribbon with bronze award numeral 1 Gallantry Cross (Vietnam) with two gold and one bronze stars Vietnam Armed Forces Honor Medal 1st class Vietnam Gallantry Cross Unit Citation Vietnam Campaign Medal ==Other websites== *Association of Graduates bio Category:1929 births Category:Living people Category:American generals Category:American military personnel of the Vietnam War Category:People from Manila
title: Arthur E. Brown Jr.
